dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, you know, it's uh, actually Lilium. They just unveiled this new seven-seat air taxi thing. They're going public via, like, a SPAC.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, you know, it's uh, actually Lilium. They just unveiled this new seven-seat air taxi thing. They're going public via, like, a S P A C.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium's unveiled a new seven seat version of its battery-powered air taxi after announcing plans for a reverse-merger with American SPAC Qell

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A seven-seat air taxi? Really? And a SPAC? I mean, who still falls for that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A seven-seat air taxi? Really? And a S P A C? I mean, who still falls for that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they're merging with Qell, Barry Engles's company, for a $3.3 billion valuation. Some analysts are calling that conservative, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they're merging with Qell, Barry Engles's company, for a three point three dollars billion valuation. Some analysts are calling that conservative, actually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article confirms the merger with Qell, Barry Engle's company, and the $3.3 billion valuation, but does not mention any analysts calling it conservative.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Conservative? That's, uh, insane! We're talking about flying cars, essentially, that, like, aren't even really flying yet!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Conservative? That's, uh, insane! We're talking about flying cars, essentially, that, like, aren't even really flying yet!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But they're raising serious money, you know, $830 million total. They're betting on revolutionizing urban transport.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they're raising serious money, you know, eight hundred thirty dollars million total. They're betting on revolutionizing urban transport.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Munich-based startup will raise $830 million through the deal with $380 million from Engles SPAC, and $450 million in private investments in public equity to fuel its bet small electric aircraft can beat the traffic on congested city roads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Revolutionizing what? Beating traffic? With, uh, a flying bus that barely exists? They shelved the five-seater, remember?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Revolutionizing what? Beating traffic? With, uh, a flying bus that barely exists? They shelved the five-seater, remember?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deal comes after Forbes revealed in February Lilium had scrapped plans for a five seat version of its aircraft

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but this new one, they're saying they'll launch commercial operations by 2024. And, uh, expand production in Munich by 30%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but this new one, they're saying they'll launch commercial operations by twenty twenty four. And, uh, expand production in Munich by thirty percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article confirms the 2024 launch date but does not mention a 30% production expansion in Munich.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: 2024? That's, what, two years from now? And flight testing for this version doesn't even start until next year. Come on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: twenty twenty four? That's, what, two years from now? And flight testing for this version doesn't even start until next year. Come on.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and flight testing for the new larger air taxi would not start until 2022.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Their CEO, Wiegand, he's saying it's, uh, unique electric jet technology. Lower cost per seat mile, quiet, low emissions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Their C E O, Wiegand, he's saying it's, uh, unique electric jet technology. Lower cost per seat mile, quiet, low emissions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are pursuing our unique electric jet technology because it is the key to higher-capacity aircraft, with lower cost per seat mile while delivering low noise and low emissions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Unique? Like Joby, who just raised $1.6 billion for their flying car? And Volocopter, too. Everyone's got a "unique" jet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unique? Like Joby, who just raised one point six dollars billion for their flying car? And Volocopter, too. Everyone's got a unique jet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Joby raised $1.6 billion in its own reverse merger with a blank-check company in February that valued the California-based business at $6.6 billion. Liliums German rival Volocopter also raised $239 million from investors including BlackRock earlier this month, according to Reuters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but Lilium's already a unicorn. Analysts are predicting they'll hit, like, $10 billion within three years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but Lilium's already a unicorn. Analysts are predicting they'll hit, like, ten dollars billion within three years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article confirms Lilium's unicorn status but does not mention any analyst predictions about a future valuation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ten billion? For a company that's still figuring out how to build a landing pad network in, uh, Florida?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ten billion? For a company that's still figuring out how to build a landing pad network in, uh, Florida?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium announced plans in January to develop a network of vertiports across Florida with Spanish infrastructure company Ferrovial

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, yeah, they're talking to Ferrovial about vertiports there, and similar networks in major European cities too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, yeah, they're talking to Ferrovial about vertiports there, and similar networks in major European cities too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium announced plans in January to develop a network of vertiports across Florida with Spanish infrastructure company Ferrovial... and revealed today that it was in talks for a similar network of shuttle landing pads in Europe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so they'll have the infrastructure before the actual, you know, flying taxis? What a business model.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so they'll have the infrastructure before the actual, you know, flying taxis? What a business model.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, that's kinda how you scale something this big, right? To, uh, beat the traffic and emissions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, that's kinda how you scale something this big, right? To, uh, beat the traffic and emissions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Beat the traffic by, uh, adding more traffic, but in the sky. Good luck with that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Beat the traffic by, uh, adding more traffic, but in the sky. Good luck with that.
